alert.note: Alert for Carbon (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 11 at 12:38PM MDT until June 14 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Billings MT has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Montana... Yellowstone River near Livingston affecting Sweet Grass and Park Counties. Clarks Fork Of The Yellowstone near Belfry affecting Carbon County. Clarks Fork Of The Yellowstone at Edgar affecting Carbon County. .Warm temperatures may melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. For the Yellowstone River...including Livingston...flooding is possible. For the Clarks Fork Of The Yellowstone...including Belfry, Edgar... flooding is possible. * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Clarks Fork Of The Yellowstone near Belfry. * WHEN...From Sunday evening to Tuesday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM MDT Saturday the stage was 7.8 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Clarks Fork Of The Yellowstone Belfry 9.0 7.8 Sat 12 pm 7.9 9.0 7.2 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: https://water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon at 1245 PM MDT.
